title: Chronic Kidney Disease Management
content: Chronic kidney disease management focuses on slowing progression and preventing complications. Key interventions include blood pressure control, preferably with ACE inhibitors or ARBs, glycemic control in diabetic patients, and proteinuria reduction. Regular monitoring of renal function, electrolytes, and metabolic parameters guides treatment adjustments. Nephrology referral is recommended for GFR <30 mL/min or complex cases.
